choices.B:
• The multicast traffic is replicated to the ports that joined a given multicast group and the peer link.
• The multicast traffic stream flows from Agg-1 to Agg-2 over the M1-to-M2 peer link and forwards the traffic over Layer 4 to Access-2.
choices.D:
• The multicast traffic is not replicated to the ports that joined a multicast group (224.0.0.13) or the peer link.
• The multicast traffic stream flows from Agg-1 to Agg-2 over the M1-to-M2 peer link and forwards the traffic over Layer 4 to Access-2.
choices.C:
• The multicast traffic is replicated to the ports that joined a given multicast group and the peer link.
• The multicast traffic stream flows over the peer link to ensure that orphan ports receive the multicast stream in failure scenarios.
choices.A:
• The multicast traffic is not replicated to the ports that joined a multicast group (224.0.0.13) or the peer link.
• The multicast traffic stream flows over the vPC link to ensure that orphan ports get the multicast stream in failure scenarios.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A source is sending a multicast traffic stream to the receiver. How is the multicast traffic expected to flow through the network when it reaches a vPC peer?

discussion.content: OPtion C confirmed by CHATGPT

Selected Answer: C
Agree C is correct 100%

Selected Answer: C
Multicast data traffic flows down the source tree to active forwarding vPC peer device. vPC peer device 1 (7K1) sends a copy of the multicast traffic out of the vPC member port connected to access switch. One another copy is sent out of vPC peer-link. As there is no single-attached device (or orphan port) interested by this multicast traffic on the other side, vPC peer device 2 (7K2) will drop the multicast traffic
BBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBB
Agree it is C
Answer A

questions.answer_description:
Cisco CloudCenter has the following key features:
- Enforce multicloud governance by guiding user decisions to reduce risk
- Securely automate deployment to reduce manual effort and get consistent results
- Increase feature velocity via integration with developer tools to accelerate time to market (CI/CD = Puppet, Chef, and Ansible).
- Optimize cloud consumption to cut pay-per-use cloud costs
Reference:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/collateral/cloud-systems-management/cloudcenter-suite/datasheet-c78-741886.html
questions.question_text: A customer wants to offload some of its order processing to a public cloud environment. The customer environment is based on Cisco ACI and uses Puppet with containerized applications. The operations team requires a solution to orchestrate and optimize the cost of the new solution. Which product must be used to meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
The correct answer is B because the Cisco CloudCenter has the following key features:
- Enforce multicloud governance by guiding user decisions to reduce risk
- Securely automate deployment to reduce manual effort and get consistent results
- Increase feature velocity via integration with developer tools to accelerate time to market (CI/CD = Puppet, Chef, and Ansible). 
- Optimize cloud consumption to cut pay-per-use cloud costs
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/collateral/cloud-systems-management/cloudcenter-suite/datasheet-c78-741886.html
